website_summaries.verdict: As an electric aspirator, this achieves high marks for its ease of use and the ability to take it apart to clean the device.
pros: Electric design works quickly and product emits minimal noise
Is very hygienic to minimize the spread of germs
Works quickly and sucks more out at once, cutting down on repetition
cons: More effective after moisturizing nostrils with saline

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for sick, congested baby
customer_reviews.text: This was seriously a life saver! My baby was sick with his first cold and he was so congested and miserable. We tried every way to remove the mucous from his nose because he was having trouble breathing. Tried the bulb syringe and the nosefrida and he would just scream bloody murder. This was a last ditch effort and I have to say this was by far easier on my baby and more effective at removing the mucous. Don't get me wrong, he still cried but he didn't scream like I was torturing him. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Babadook84

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I had tried the Nose Frieda and the bulbs from the hospital but nothing could fit it my babies tiny noses except this. Along with nasal spray it works great at getting boogies out. My twins would get nasaly and obviously had boogers in their noses and I couldn't get them until I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Baby doesn't cry when using it
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I was a little skeptical at first because I bought the graco one and it was garbage. My friend recommended this one to me so I tried it and I've been using it constantly for about 3 months now I love it! It's been a live saver the couple of times my baby has been sick and I'm constantly using it. She doesn't even cry when I use it totally worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: So fast, effective and easy!
customer_reviews.text: We previously used the NoseFrida after all the positive feedback we heard on it, but after switching to this battery operated aspirator, I can't believe how much time we wasted trying to wrangle my son and get him to hold still long enough for us to get good manual suction. Don't get me wrong, the NoseFrida is hreat, but this has so much suction power, and works so fast (as soon as you get it to the edge of the nostril), that for us, there's no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie D.

customer_reviews.title: Best aspirator for stuffy baby noses
customer_reviews.text: It works. Plus I don't have to put anything in my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs H

customer_reviews.title: it works wonderfully and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Where was this when I had my other kids? This is a must have if you have small infants or children....it works wonderfully and worth every penny. It gets all the gooey nasty boogies and mucous out that a regular nasal aspirator just can't or doesn't. It's easy to clean and has a great suction and my kids don't freak out about having to be suctioned when using this like they do with a nose Frieda or a regular bulb aspirator. This is a Godsend!!
customer_reviews.author: Totally Banana's TV

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have bought this one first
customer_reviews.text: If you're like us, you bought the old school bulb aspirator before your baby was born b/c the thought of the mouth powered ones was disgusting. After he arrived and you couldn't get her nose clean you upgraded to a tube/mouth suction device and didn't think twice about how nauseating the concept actually was. The alternative's are 1/2 the price and at best work half as well. I bought them both thinking I was being frugal, but in the end ended up spending more than I should have. tldr; buy this one and don't waste your money on the others. It is simply the best. I've tried the rest.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Cincinnati

customer_reviews.title: Ticklish and Effective!
customer_reviews.text: My son (almost 4 months) loves when we use this in his nose. It works effectively and makes his nose less stuffy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rayo

customer_reviews.title: did not realize I should be closing the other nostril for better suction.
customer_reviews.text: So handy to use. did not realize I should be closing the other nostril for better suction.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: This beats every other method i have tried to decongest my baby’s nose! It surprised my how much came out when I first used it! Quick way to relieve my baby from a stuffy nose! Very happy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Most effective, easy to use product in its class! We have tried many different competitors nasal aspirators that don't add up. This is my go-to baby shower gift now!
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Designed, well made product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and good quality. Provides gentle, continuous suction for infants and toddlers. Recommend using nasal saline spray if mucus is think. Easy to clean and keep sanitary. My son had no issues with me using the device on him. This is so much better than those old, suction bulbs of the past!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to nose frida
customer_reviews.text: My son is finicky and we have to hold him down doing this...that obviously has more to do with my son than the actual product. It has a faint rumbling noise I don't think he likes but immediately after writing my review customer service reached out to me and gave me some tips on making the process perhaps better. I appreciate that more than anything else because they really care about their product. As far as it actually working, if he wasn't thrashing his head back and forth...with some saline beforehand I think this would ease him of a lot of the mucus that builds up while he has a cold.
customer_reviews.author: Ksalz9348

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful. I was excited for it to come when reading what great reviews it got. My son is so so snotty right now and it did not suck anything out.. even the saline I put in his nose. Not sure how people say it’s better than the nose frida. I tried using this first then the nose frida and so much came out. The suction power is nothing! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Clark

customer_reviews.title: Kids don't like it but they don't like any nasal bulb
customer_reviews.text: Kids don't like it but they don't like any nasal bulb. This is amazing however, get all of the goop out of their nostrils and extremely easy to clean and sanitize. Easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good suction, and the length of the device is comfy to hold and operate. A quick rinse with hot soapy water and it's good to go again! Worth spending the extra money to get this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than nose frida for boogers!
customer_reviews.text: I started out with the nose Frida and it did not work for us. Maybe because it's a "snot sucker" and what I really needed was a booger sucker! This thing works great and fast to get them out and it so easy to clean. I was hesitant to spend $30 but it's something I use daily. Causes a lot less fuss from baby than the frida as well. Also no filters to replace!
customer_reviews.author: Meser

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!!! I never write reviews but this arrived today and I used it on my 3 month old who is struggling with a cold... completely cleared him out!! He seemed to feel so much better after and ate better than he has in days!!! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Yes! This will be my new baby shower gift given to everyone! How was their that much snot in my little 8lb baby's nose!?
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Suction is a little better when one nostril is pressed shut
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. Suction is a little better when one nostril is pressed shut. I think this is really handy and convenient and less gross than the nose frida which also works great. I have all three - this, nose frida and the bulb. I use them interchangeably but have to say this aspirator is my favorite. I don't think the noise is an issue for baby.
customer_reviews.author: Hf

customer_reviews.title: shoots snot on your face, poor design
customer_reviews.text: This nose aspirator by design has a tiny hole and if you are suctioning, the contents will get thrown in your face when you hit the suction button. As your child gets older and/or has loose secretions this device is useless unless you want snot shot all over your face. Had it for 2 years, it's ok for babies but not children. Motor still runs after 2 years but poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Pleitez

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and super quick to use
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and super quick to use. My 3 yr Old and my 7 mo Old had gotten a really bad cold, I was sucking their nose with the bulb atleast 12-15 times a day. I only had to do it 3-4 times a day when I started to use this! Saves me the heartache and torture! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item about 4 months ago when my newborn had his first stuffy nose. It has been a life saver where it helped me get many boogers out from his tiny nostrils. Just remember to drop saline into baby's nostrils few seconds prior to using this product~~
customer_reviews.author: HKim

customer_reviews.title: Great and hygenic
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use and baby doesn't cry as much as when we were using the Nose Frida (she still cries though). Hygenic and the amount of snot we see when we clean it out is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much better than NoseFrida!
customer_reviews.text: Obsessed!!! My baby didn't cry at all w this, it was insanely easy and took two seconds to use and you didn't have to get an ab and lung workout sucking away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: life saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: it saves my life and my 3 months old baby loves it, I tried nosefrida before and it does the job but my baby was still fussy and the nasal congestion did not go away 100%. This product does a great job and your baby will have a better sleep which is important for them to fully recover from a bad cold. BUY IT BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Viviana

customer_reviews.title: Baby hated the nose Frieda
customer_reviews.text: Baby hated the nose Frieda. Oddly enough he doesn't mind this and has laughed while I've used it to extract several impressive boogers. Haven't had to deal with full blown running snot but I suspect it will work for that just fine. The weather is really dry though so I do have to loosen the boogies with saline first.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: The best thing
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING!! My son would scream and carry on horribly the second you came near him with the "bulb". So desperately i started to explore my options and came across this product. I was a bit skeptical at first because i heard so many people say how electric ones don't work. After reading the reviews i decided to give it a chance and i am SO happy i did. It has worked wonders for us and my son is now calm while i am cleaning his nose!!! Couldn't have asked for anything more!
customer_reviews.author: KyleL

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: What a complete waste of money. I wish I'd never bought it. The nose frida always leaves me out of breath, but at least it works. I've tried using this with different types of snot (more runny vs drier), and it doesn't work with either. In both cases, I've sprayed saline first, tried this, got nothing, then tried Nose Frida and gotten a fair amount of snot out. I've tried pushing it in further, rotating it to different positions, the other insert, nothing works. It's just a piece of garbage. Save yourself the trouble and stick to the nose frida :(
customer_reviews.author: Elishema Fishman

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than squeeze bulbs, short lifespan.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this at the recommendation of the pediatrician at the local urgent care who said she used it for her own children. It works MUCH better than the old fashioned squeeze bulb and seems to help keep my son a little calmer during the process as well, though it’s clearly his least favorite activity. Update to the review: The unit continued to work great right until it didn’t. For two weeks, it’s only worked with the battery compartment removed. Today, it stopped working completely. We’re purchasing another, but I wish I could get more than 4.5 months of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dill

customer_reviews.title: Like blowing your nose, you have to close one side
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I really like this product. It is pretty easy to use and clean. Some things that helped us were to close one nostril while sucking the other (much like blowing your own nose). It seems to draw out the snot much better that way. Also, using the saline drops prior to use allows for it to draw out easier too. Downside, baby doesn't like having his nose plugged while using. When the batteries start to die it starts to suck less effeciently. Overall, I would recommend this product to someone else in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not a super sucker.
customer_reviews.text: We have had the nosefrida before this, but the filter finally wore out and it always grossed me out a little so we decided to go electric. This aspirator is easy to take apart to clean and reassemble. It seems to get some snot, but the frida seemed to get more, so I'm not sure if it is powerful enough. Both of my little have colds and are really stuffed up and it seems like sometimes it can clear there noses, but sometimes they are still stuffed up after using this aspirator. I have not tired using saline first to loosen things up, that may help. Still seems like an ok buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn & Kristen Newton

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my grand daughter and her mom ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grand daughter and her mom says it works well. Since my grand daughter likes to push buttons she enjoys turning the nasal aspirator on and off and it's making it easier to clean her nose out!
customer_reviews.author: adagrammy

customer_reviews.title: The best for newborn and up
customer_reviews.text: My newborn was tiny and had allergies within days being out of the womb. The problem I had was that her little nostrils were too small for the little bulb they give you to help clean her nose. This has been perfect for her! It doesn’t just come with an applicator small enough for her but also one for my bigger kids or even me. Now at 5 months and teething it’s a life saver for sure! It’s wonderful to be able to suck out all the mucus from her nose cuz the drooling is causing a lot of stuffiness for her. She’s not afraid of it either so it’s always easy clearing her nose. Best purchase every!
customer_reviews.author: Phaithe Reyes-Leonti

customer_reviews.title: Powerful suction!!! What a joke
customer_reviews.text: I have used this since the purchase and my review does not change!!!! Powerful suction!!! What a joke. The green suction pump is better than this which I received from hospital. Nothing came out from Nose when I used it alone OR with Saline. With the Green suction pump a lot of mucus came out which OBVIOUSLY this Aspirator failed to extract! With squirmy and moving baby it is absolutely impossible to get a better fit inside the nose so the air doesn't escape. Waste of money. DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: It's a great products works really good on babies. However it stopped working a few months ago. I thought the batteries were dead so I replaced them and still there was no suction power. I went to the company's website because it's still under the manufacturers warranty however all my emails went unanswered and when I tried calling I got nowhere just an automated system. I refuse to pay $40 for another one and really wish that there was something that either Amazon or the company can do
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t work at all for us. I tried it on our newborn and nothing. Tried it on myself and ended up with a bloody mess (guess it cut a tiny vain). We returned this and went back to using the NoseFrida which works every time.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: At the push of a button our baby breathes easier!
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use and fits on baby's nostrils so much better than the popular manual suck brand. We got the blue and looks nice enough to keep out to use as needed. Stands on its own which is nice, but not large enough that we can't easily throw into his diaper caddy at our changing station. Comes apart for easy cleaning. This also came with a nail clipper which is better than the one we originally bought. Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: BonneCassie

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product in a video on a friends page and instantly googled it to find out how i can get it for my new born who suffers from allergies and stuffy nose. I’ve tried everything even the blow in the mouth technique (didn’t feel comfortable doing that) nothing seemed to work . My newborn would be so fussy because she couldn’t sleep due to stuffy nose.Thankfully this product worked as promised and was easy to operate. No complaints whatsoever.thanks☺️
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Suck that snot!
customer_reviews.text: Neat little device. Attractive and sleek Comes with an extra top so you don't have to wait for the first one to dry after cleaning to use it again. Came with batteries which was nice although I found using duracell batteries worked better and created a stronger suction. Device is a bit loud bit that was a good distraction for my snotty little guy. It comes with these nifty nail clippers that have a magnifying glass attached to make sure you get a precision nail trimming for your little one.
customer_reviews.author: Macey L Mikesell

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for both my 4 year old and my 2 year. I like it better than the nose Frida because I would always get sick sucking the snot. The trick with this though is to avoid getting ear infections, have the kids clear their snot first and then use it. I don’t know if that makes sense but that’s that I’ve learned.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn O

customer_reviews.title: Great for newborns!
customer_reviews.text: Much more suction power than the occu baby nasal. Able to get boogies out without saline. Could still use more suction power but for a portable device it’s great. My newborn hates it but does much better after clearing her nose.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction to be effective
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this because it had such good reviews. The first time I used the device it took forever just to suck some snot out. Then the second time I had to give up and use the asperator from the hospital. My baby girl also did not like this device because it had to be in her nose a long time. The hand held asperator from the hospital does not phase her one bit. I personally do not recommend this product because the suction is not powerful enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It gets snot out so much better than those little nasal aspirators. We use this for my 4 month old son and he doesn't mind it at all. Sometimes it doesn't suck overly well but if you wiggle it around in the nose it will suck up the snot.
customer_reviews.author: LeslieA

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: I barely got any mucus out of my newborn’s nostrils with this. It seems like the quality is great and it’s sturdy, but it just didn’t work for us. We’ve been using the NoseFrida instead for both our children.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! My son jumps and squirms the minute he sees the bulb or nose frida come close to him. However, with this one he starts to squirm and the minute he sees the elephant sticker and hears the humming of the battery he freezes and lets me get to his nose. This product has been a huge help during those high congestion and runny nose times!
customer_reviews.author: James O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Baby hates this slightly less than the snot sucker or the bulb syringe. Easy to clean. I love that I don’t have to suck in air or fumble with repositioning a bulb while handling an unhappy squirming infant;)
customer_reviews.author: Temporary a.

customer_reviews.title: No suction!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter who was having her first child. Very disappointed in this product! There is hardly any suction. When the baby would be stuffy or have a runny nose, the suction wouldn’t suck anything out! It’s sad when you spend this much money on a nasal suction for it not to work at all. Very disappointed. Would not recommend to anyone. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great for boogers!
customer_reviews.text: We love this items for boogers. It's not strong enough for snot. To use it for boogers you have to wiggle it around in their nose but it gets it. We use a mouth powered nose sucker for the snot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good alternative to the bulb
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. It's a good alternative to the bulb, especially when you have others watching your baby and they won't use the nose frida. I found it works better if you plug the other nostril. It also takes longer than I thought to get the boogers out. Update: great service from his vendor. They had great tips and tricks to maximize the potential for this device. They care about their customers and experience. I'd recommend them and this product after applying their suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Haas

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like it on my infant but did wonderful on my toddler
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my two month old. Tried it out and was disappointed big time. Same time my 19 month old was having headcold so I had nothing to lose but try it on her and boy oh boy! All this loose mucus was sucked it fast, my husband and I just looked at each other amazed! So it’s a keeper, not working for dry boogies even with a saline but great for runny nose for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Vicki Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Yanks the booggers right out
customer_reviews.text: It really yanks the booggies out of my son's nose better than a manual aspirator would and it's not gross like that nose frida where you have to suck out the snot from a tube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best option available
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and both work flawlessly. It’s much quicker and easier to use than the manual options with a kiddo wiggling around while trying to clean their nose. Excellent product bought the second because I thought I left it on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: bearcat

customer_reviews.title: Its meh
customer_reviews.text: Mostly use this with our 2 year old. For thin runny noses works fine, but thicker snot it's not very helpful. Also, when it's too full watch out, there is a air hole where you can get shot at, that was a nice surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Poy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and thoughtful company behind it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because my infant has been perpetually congested recently due to the revolving door of kids sharing colds. It's compact enough for on-the-go use or to stash in a medicine cabinet. What really won me over, however, was the customer service from the company. I received a message checking in on if my order arrived as it should, which certainly exceeds my expectations. This is super easy to use and clean, and my kiddo is already feeling better. Great purchase. Would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Gorski

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as I would like.
customer_reviews.text: This product is convenient; however, it is not as powerful as I would like. It is very easy to clean though which is a plus. But my daughter has RSV so we needed something that would help me (who is also sick) suck out her nose during the day while my husband who is not sick is at work.
customer_reviews.author: KLS+MLS

customer_reviews.title: This is so much better. The silicone tip is the key
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had this 3 children ago! I’ve alwas used a Nose Frida. This is so much better. The silicone tip is the key! My 6 month old will actually hold still and just let me do this. Gets gobs of snot out. This is my new baby shower gift!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: I wished I bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This is mu h easier than the Nose Frieda because I lose my breath. This is much easier to use and your squirmie toddler actually enjoys this. It surely collects a lot of mucous. It's really easy to remove the tip and the base of the silicone/rubber part which grabby toddlers can pull it off while in use. BUT it's super awesome and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this but it did not suck well enough
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this but it did not suck well enough. It’s also very loud which scared my son even though we introduced him to it gently. What was good was the soft nose tips and that’s it’s easy to clean. As gross as it sounds, the NoseFrida works very well and we’ll have to stick with that.
customer_reviews.author: Yacova Mimer

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near as good as a Nose Frida
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how some reviews said this is as good as the Nose Frida. It’s nowhere close. It works if they’re super super stuffed up, you use saline, and plug the other side but you can use this and THEN the nose Frida and you’ll still get more with the Frida.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: No suction power!
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever! I tried to use it several time without success, even when my baby's nose is full of mucus this thing doesn't suck anything. I am using the cheapest soluton ( Nose Frida ) and it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Claudiu

customer_reviews.title: The sound may scare your LO
customer_reviews.text: My LO (5 mos.) is still scared of it since she's been used to the Frieda. It sucks just as well minus me actually doing the work. We are slowly desensitizing her to it by including it during play time.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction
customer_reviews.text: in theory this would be great, however it does not have the suction needed to actually clear baby's nose. I ended up using the manual aspirator as it was much more effective. Disappointing, I really wanted this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli G.

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is excellent, but it just did not work on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is excellent, but it just did not work on my baby. NOTHING came out. Then I used the Nose Frida and a bunch came out. Just not strong enough I guess. I swear by the Nose Frida in conjunction with the Little Remedies Baby Sterile Saline Mist.
customer_reviews.author: melimm

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: 💙💙💙💙💙 this product! It is the best thing for baby snot. I tried everything and this is amazing. I could not survive without it! Highly recommend this for any mom. Put a few saline drops before into baby’s nostril and see the magic happen. You will have a happier baby!!!
customer_reviews.author: franchesca

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! My 2yr old daughter was a scared at first but after a couple uses she doesn't really care too much. I Wish the suction was a little stronger but I don't know what I would do without it. Definitely recommend for anyone with a child.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki P

customer_reviews.title: Could have gone without
customer_reviews.text: The suction on this was nothing. I was hoping for something a little stronger to actually get the nastiness out of my little ones nose, but no such luck. Just going to stick with Nose Frida.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Really like but the clippers are scary!
customer_reviews.text: Love the nasal aspirator but the clippers that come with it are scary sharp. I cut the skin off my 2 week olds finger!!!! The magnifying glass gets in the way more than anything. The nasal aspirator is quieter than others that I have had. The 2 sizes of tips really work well with growing kids/ babies.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Pauly

customer_reviews.title: Better than the hospital aspirator
customer_reviews.text: Such a fantastic idea! The collection cup has ridges in it which makes it a bit hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: M.Trask

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: This does not work at all. Do not waste your money. Weve tried to use this on our son. We could see snot in his nose, put this on and it sucks up nothing. Weve tried spraying saline first, still nothing. It is lost money on our part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works wonderfully!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the people who say this doesn't work. Don't be afraid to stick the tube up their nose it doesn't need to sit on the outside. This works wonderfully!!!! Always use a saline spray with any nasal aspiration too! Loved this and will recommend to mom friends
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Light

customer_reviews.title: Little nose is so happy and clean :)
customer_reviews.text: What a savior ! Cleans little nose very fast, make sure to keep one nostril closed while sucking the other. Works like magic!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: quick, effective and stess free
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I've made for my little guy. Was using the traditional bulb suctioner and he hated it so much I had to wrap him in a blanket and hold him down to use it causing much stress for us both. Now with this product he sits on my lap and I can use it effectively with one hand to relieve his nasel congestion. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: angel mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works! Though no completely to the point where all the boogers and snot gets sucked into the chamber, but it does draw it out so we can wipe/pull the entire thing out of his nose. To use: 1. Wet cotton tips to wet the nose 2. Use thumb to close one mistrial 3. Suck the other one using nasal aspirator
customer_reviews.author: YuHanXi

customer_reviews.title: very useful during this cold season for my two kids
customer_reviews.text: Works well, very useful during this cold season for my two kids. It is a gentle suction that gets yuckie stuff faster than using the syring bulb. My 6month old liked the vibration, my 2 year old would run everytime he saw me grab it (lol). I really loved the nail clipper it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Vanchi83

customer_reviews.title: Gentle suction perfect for flu season
customer_reviews.text: Loved the motorized function of this nose sucker. The suction itself doesn’t pull everything out completely, but then again I think it might harm try Little’s nose if it did that. Mostly pulls mucus to the entrance of the nose so we can extract gently. Paired with a saline, helped us get through flu season very well!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Gates

customer_reviews.title: Easy on mom, child and budget
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for my 2 year old for a couple of days and love it. It's easy to clean and clears him out with less pain and time than a bulb syringe.
customer_reviews.author: Heather E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but doesn’t suck almost nothing
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have enough suction power, and the noise will keep the baby trying to grab it and play with it. 3 starts because of the construction materials which seems pretty good but that’s pretty much it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pato

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my twins
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to remove any mucus with this item. It was a total waste is money. Buy yourself a saline spray (not drops) and a normal suction device and save the money for diapers...or scotch. I won't judge.
customer_reviews.author: K. Alspaugh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute god send for baby head colds! My 8 month old has been so snotty for past week and this has made life so much easier. He isn’t a fan of the regular bulb aspirators but thinks this is funny. He laughs every time we use it
customer_reviews.author: d's dogs

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this about 3 times already, it’s so much better than the suction bulb. My 3m old hates it, but I’m sticking an object up her nose.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri N Page

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The product and packaging itself is great. My toddler was more willing with this product as opposed to the nose Frida. Unfortunately for me the suction didnt seem strong enough and wasnt able to get much of anything out but seller reached out with some suggestions and valuable feedback that I will be trying.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best product
customer_reviews.text: Every mom needs this! The bulb syringe is unsanitary and hard to use. This product you push a button and it does the work for you! I use it with little noses saline drops. Plus the vibration he loves!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I would like it. However it works really well. I would recommend it to anyone. The only thing is I wish it had a little bit stronger suction. Other than that diffently get the jobs done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works well
customer_reviews.text: My infant constantly has boogies in her nostrils which don’t allow her to breath very well. The traditional suction bulbs never work and she just gets frustrated. This has worked so good and she actually lets me do it!
customer_reviews.author: tshepar09

customer_reviews.title: Booger vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so great! The only reason I am giving this 4 stars is because it doesn't do well with thick snot- BUT if you spray a little saline in their before you suck it works great. Easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: RLL*

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Quiet n easy to use. The suction power however isn't strong at all. The snot had to be really moist in order to get it out. Nose frieda is much better. A waste of my money buying this one
customer_reviews.author: DreamyEyez14

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: We were very hopeful but it doesn’t work at all...just makes boise. We were also promised a free manual nose sucker as a gift and never received it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong but it ...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong but it doesn’t seem to work for my 10 month old. I don’t get anything out. However I gave it 3 stars because i tried it on myself (to see if maybe the pressure was too low) with the bigger nasal piece and did get a decent amount of mucous. Will try again with the next cold
customer_reviews.author: VauneC

customer_reviews.title: Best way to relieve congestion for babies and toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best purchase, SO much easier than Nose Frieda or other equivalents. My one- year old doesn't fuss while using this because it's so gentle and fast to use and it really removes the congestion! Because of this we've seen her colds shorten and heal faster too. Wish we had this from the start, great gift for any new parent.
customer_reviews.author: Roohina Banani

customer_reviews.title: like torture poor thing
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. It works but it really freaks my toddler out, like torture poor thing. It does not suck out as well as the mouth versions, but those are so gross and I always ended up with the cold, even though I'd put new filters. So not as well, but they still suck out if you wait long enough and its more sanitary than the mouth versions.
customer_reviews.author: hlhs mama

customer_reviews.title: Sticking with the suction ball from the hospital
customer_reviews.text: I felt with any consistency of mucus from our child it didn’t really suck it up. It more or less moved it around in his nose.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Ask

customer_reviews.title: ... doing it wrong but the nose frida works way better than this
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I’m doing it wrong but the nose frida works way better than this. I have yet to suck out any snot with this thing. Not enough suction
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: So easy a toddler can use it.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried every baby nasal aspirator from the bulbs, mom powered, to medical grade suction machines. This works just as well as the medical grade machines, but at a fraction of the cost. My babies use to hate getting their noses sucked, but this is so gentle there are no more tantrums. And so easy to use that my toddler does it on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Flutterby

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! My 2 month old was just diagnosed with RSV and I had been using the nose frida to help with snot BUT I hated it! It wouldn’t get anything out and I hated having to suck on that thing! Not only me but my baby hated it he screamed!!! But this nose sucker hasn’t made a world of difference! He doesn’t scream when I use it and it actually gets the snot out well!! Which is so important for his RSV to go away! Would definitely recommend to mommies!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful when I found this product as my kids have been so stuffy. I purchased one to try it out and it does not work. The suction was little to non existent and I tried a few seperate time and could not get anything out, even when the snot was visible and loose. I am so bummed that this product did now work for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could use more power
customer_reviews.text: I love this for boogies that just won't come out. The suction isn't quite strong enough for the snot that is stuck in the back which is why I bought it. It's much easier to use than one where you manually suck the snot. I'm happy with it just wish it had some more power.
customer_reviews.author: bridge

customer_reviews.title: This product really works!
customer_reviews.text: It’s wonderful! I’ve never seen my son smile so hard when usually he dreads having his nose cleaned. It’s gentle, easy to use, and easy to clean. I highly recommend getting this for your little one if you have trouble cleaning out their nose. Plus the nail clipper that comes with the aspirator is a wonderful little gift that certainly adds to the helpfulness of taking care of your little one.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have enough suction. I wasted $35 on this. My manual nose freida does better than this. Don't waste your money. My 3 month old has nasal congestion associated with teething that doesn't ever actually run out of his nose. Its just stuck in his sinus cavities and this product doesn't budge any of it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Cela

customer_reviews.title: No hassle, simple, easy and cleanly
customer_reviews.text: My baby hates the nasal bulb from the hospital, so I tried the nasal aspirator. She loves it and it is so much easier to get her nose cleaned out. She actually likes the noise it makes. It is so simple to use and just as easy to clean. I would definitely recommend this for new moms. I wish I would have found this product sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Little Martins Drawer Baby Electric Nasal Aspirator - Safe, Fast, Hygienic Automatic Snot Sucker for Newborn Infant Toddler and Kids - Battery Operated Nose Cleaner
